greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{m>=1} (1 + m*q^m)^-2.
comment: This sequence is obtained from the generalized Euler transform in A266964 by taking f(n) = 2, g(n) = -n. - _Seiichi Manyama_, Dec 30 2017
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
program: (PARI) m=50; q='q+O('q^m); Vec(prod(n=1,m,1/(1+n*q^n)^2)) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 25 2018
(MAGMA) Coefficients(&*[1/(1+m*x^m)^2:m in [1..40]])[1..40] where x is PolynomialRing(Integers()).1; // _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 25 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
